prompt: <description>Part 1: Base Rectangular Prism Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.0075). Sketch Create a new face. On this face, create a loop by following these steps: 1. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.75, 0). 2. Draw a line from (0.75, 0) to (0.75, 0.375). 3. Draw a line from (0.75, 0.375) to (0, 0.375). 4. Close the loop by drawing a line from (0, 0.375) to (0, 0). Apply a scale of 0.75 to the sketch. Extrusion Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by 0.0075 units. Part 2: Angled Rectangular Prism Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0.0245, 0.1575, 0.0075). Sketch Create a new face. On this face, create a loop by following these steps: 1. Draw a line from (0, 0) to (0.0964, 0). 2. Draw a line from (0.0964, 0) to (0.0964, 0.0669). 3. Draw a line from (0.0964, 0.0669) to (0, 0.0669). 4. Close the loop by drawing a line from (0, 0.0669) to (0, 0). Apply no scale to the sketch. Extrusion Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by 0.0004 units. Then, extrude the sketch in the opposite direction of its normal by 0 units. Final Shape The final shape combines the base rectangular prism (Part 1) and the angled rectangular prism (Part 2) using the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation. The resulting shape is a rectangular prism with a pointed top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the sides are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The pointed top is at one end of the prism, and the flat bottom is at the other end. The dimensions of the shape are 0.75 units by 0.75 units by 0.0075 units (width, length, and height). Please note that all the measurements and instructions provided are based on the given JSON data. Additional assumptions are not made.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a pyramid-shaped protrusion Construct a pyramid-shaped protrusion. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.6033, 0.0] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Within this sketch, draw a square with the following lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5464] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5464], End Point [0.0, 0.5464] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5464], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop. The resulting face is `face_1`. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.3016 towards the normal of the sketch, and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object Construct a cylindrical object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.155, 0.3016, 0.0532] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Within this sketch, draw two concentric circles (`circle_1`) with the following details: * Circle 1 (inner): Center [0.22, 0.22], Radius 0.1703 * Circle 2 (outer): Center [0.22, 0.22], Radius 0.22 These circles will form two concentric loops (`loop_1` and `loop_2`) in the sketch. Close each loop. Scale the 2D sketch to 0.44 times its current size. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.3016 towards the normal of the sketch, and 0.0 in the opposite direction. The resulting 3D assembly will be a cylindrical object with a pyramid-shaped protrusion. The protrusion will be slightly larger than the cylinder's diameter. The model is symmetrical along the cylinder's axis.</description>
